https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The study of industrial mineral resources, i.e. geological materials that are mined/quarried for their commercial value and are not fuel (fuel minerals or mineral fuels) or sources of metals (metallic minerals) but are used in their natural state or after beneficiation either as raw materials or as additives in a wide range of applications based on their physical and/or chemical properties. These studies include the quantification of the physical properties, chemical properties, volumes, and limitations to development of quarry products. Quarry resources (also referred to as basic raw materials or industrial minerals) include, but may not be limited to, sand (including silica sand), clay, hard rock (including dimension stone), limestone (including metallurgical limestone), agricultural lime, gravel, gypsum, other construction and road building materials and materials which may substitute these raw materials.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Compiled by Geological Survey of western Australia.
